DataElement.preferredName: Cell Lineage Acceptable Criterion Certification Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to signify whether measures of measures of cell lineage have met established criteria for acceptance.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A special type of antigen-presenting cell (APC) that activates T lymphocytes._Capable of life or normal growth and development._A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose._Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source._Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc_Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc_Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source.:Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc

Concepts.definition: Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source.

A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Property.preferredDefinition: Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures.:A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: Satisfying an established set of qualifying measures.

The process by which a person demonstrates specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, the process by which a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Capable of life or normal growth and development._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied._Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source.:Criteria; a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated.:A designation earned by a person that indicates that the person has specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of the certifying body.  Similarly, a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Descent in a line from a common progenitor or source.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

The process by which a person demonstrates specific knowledge, skills, or abilities in the view of a certifying body.  Similarly, the process by which a product or process can achieve certification indicating its suitability for a specific purpose.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D
